results.title: Alphaville
results.creator_credit: Athos Film, Pathe Films, Andre Michelin and Jean-Luc Godard
results.brief_description: A secret agent, posing as a journalist, from the ‘the world without’, penetrates ‘the world within’ - Alphaville. In his version of a futuristic dystopia, Jean-Luc Godard embraces a tech-noir aesthetic where human beings have become robotic slaves to technology, deprived of individuality and independent thought. In “Alphaville” the hero, played by Eddie Constantine with an embittered edge, evoking the ghost of Philipe Marlowe, has a mission to eliminate an eminent professor, the inventor of Alpha 60, a superior computer that governs society. The professor’s daughter, Natasha, played with an alluringly demure sensuality by Anna Karina, is the detective’s guide and also his love interest as he negotiates the bizarre, totalitarian state. Godard’s narrative is littered with numerous references, in particular, Aldous Huxley’s “Brave New World” and George Orwell’s “1984”. Godard uses the modernist 1960 Paris aesthetic to great effect, succeeding in presenting the city as a glimmering, ominous prison, where absurd and inhumane policies intermingle. Several memorable sequences include a firing squad - a cultural performance, accompanied by elegant water ballet sequences - that is witnessed by an admiring audience. An unusual addition to the canon of French New Wave cinema. Glorious black and white cinematography by Raoul Coutard. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Almost famous [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Vinyl Films, Ian Bryce and Cameron Crowe
results.brief_description: Director Cameron Crowe’s experience as a teenage journalist for “Rolling Stone” magazine was the inspiration for this academy award winning film. Set in the 1970s, William Miller (Patrick Fugit) lives with his loving but over-protective mother Elaine (Frances McDormand), rebelling against her by writing music reviews for an underground newspaper. He is discovered by Lester Bangs (Philip Seymour Hoffman), editor of a controversial rock magazine, and is hired to review a Black Sabbath concert. While he is unable to review the band, he interviews opening act ‘Stillwater’, and the resulting article gains the attention of “Rolling Stone” magazine. Despite his mother’s distrust in the world of rock music, William joins Stillwater on tour, becomes friends with the band, falls for leader of the ‘Band-aids’, Penny Lane (Kate Hudson), and discovers what really goes on behind the scenes in the rock and roll world. Cast includes Billy Crudup, Jason Lee, Anna Paquin, Fairuza Balk, Noah Taylor, Bijou Phillips and Zooey Deschanel. (Awards: Academy Awards, Cameron Crowe for Best Screenplay).

results.title: Allies
results.creator_credit: Cinema Enterprises, Sylvie Le Clezio and Marian Wilkinson
results.brief_description: A frank look at the relations between Australia and the United States since 1945 and the cost of that friendship. It is the story, told by men with first-hand involvement, of the cold war in Australia and the setting up of ASIO; it is the story of Sir Robert Menzies’ ambitions to follow the U.S. into Vietnam in order to demonstrate loyalty to the alliance.

results.title: All the pretty horses
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Miramax Films, Robert Salerno and Billy Bob Thornton
results.brief_description: John Grady Cole (Matt Damon) and his friend Lacey Rawlins (Henry Thomas) are young Texan men dreaming of an exciting life as cowboys. They set out for Mexico in search of employment, adventure and a better life. On their travels they met Jimmy Blevins (Lucas Black), a drifter wanted for stealing a horse, and they allow him to join their travels. In Mexico, they begin working for Hector de la Rocha (Ruben Blades), a wealthy landowner, raising his young and idealistic daughter, Alejandra (Penelope Cruz) alone. When Alejandra professes her love for Cole, her aunt (Miriam Colon) fights desperately to break up their love affair. When the authorities discover the boys working on the property, their past catches up with them and they are arrested for the theft of the horse. Cole must fight to prove his innocence and win back Alejandra. A coming of age western directed by Billy Bob Thornton, based on the novel of the same time by Cormac McCarthy.

results.title: All the mornings of the world = Tous les matins du monde
results.creator_credit: Film Par Film, Divali Films, DD Productions, SEDIF, FR3 Films, Paravision International, Jean-Louis Livi and Alain Corneau
results.brief_description: An award winning production recounting the life story of master 17th Century musician M de Saint Colombe (Jean-Paul Marielle) and his brilliant protege, Marin Marais. Marais (Gerard Depardieu), reflects on his life as a student when he fell in love with his mentor’s eldest daughter Madeleine (Anne Brochet). Guillaume Depardieu portrays the young Marais. The musical score, costumes and settings are outstanding.

results.title: All the King's Men
results.brief_description: A riveting thriller about corruption in the political arena. Willie Stark, a dynamic backwoods lawyer, batters his way into the Governor’s mansion with the help of his hard boiled secretary, Sadie Burke and reporter Jack Burden. Once elected, Willie uses his unprincipled charm to become a brutal dictator, but his unquenchable thirst for power threatens to topple the monarch and his kingdom. Stars: Broderick Crawford, John Ireland, Mercedes McCambridge. Based on the novel by Robert Penn Warren.

results.title: All that jazz [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Robert A Aurthur and Bob Fosse
results.brief_description: Joe Gideon is a chain-smoking, pill popping workaholic obsessed with producing, directing and choreographing a Broadway musical while womanising and editing his latest film (actually Fosse’s own film “Lenny”). This semi-autobiographical musical drama is framed by Gideon’s conversations with a mysterious figure of nemesis the “Lady in White”. Following Gideon’s heart attack, the film assumes a surreal hallucinatory logic. Not only does Fosse borrow freely from the European classics “8 1/2” and “The Seventh seal” but he inverts the showbiz and life affirming “That’s entertainment” ethos of the traditional musical. Cast includes Roy Scheider, Jessica Lange, Ann Reinking and John Lithgow. Awards: Winner, Best Art Direction, Costume Design, Editing, Best Score, Academy Awards, 1979.

results.title: All quiet on the Western Front
results.creator_credit: Marble Arch Productions, Norman Rosemont and Delbert Mann
results.brief_description: Made for television, this adaptation of Erich Maria Remarque’s passionate anti-war novel is a remake of the 1930’s film classic about young German soldiers in the Great war of 1914-18, and of the veteran who teaches them to grow up fast in the trenches. Stars Richard Thomas, Ernest Borgnine, Patricia Neal, Ian Holm and Donald Pleasence.

results.title: All quiet on the western front
results.brief_description: Regarded as a landmark in American cinema, and a film which pioneered depiction of the “irony” of war. The directional quality has been compared with Eisenstein for its biting commentary and emotional outcry against war. Its bravura direction fixed in millions of viewers minds the image of youth in the trenches. Lead star, Lew Ayres, became a true-to-life conscientious objector of war after portraying its moving scenes.

results.title: All dogs go to heaven
results.creator_credit: Sullivan Bluth Studios Ireland, Don Bluth, Gary Goldman and John Pomeroy
results.brief_description: Don Bluth, the acclaimed animator of “An American Tail” transports us into a wonderful world of animals and adventure. Featuring the voices of Burt Reynolds, Dom DeLuise and Loni Anderson. Charlie is a rascal but a hero nevertheless. This canine rogue’s michievious streak gets him into serious trouble until he learns the value of friendship and goodness.
